Kindle Oasis E-reader with Leather Charg.text: Very lightweight and portable with excellent battery life.
I like this so much more than the Voyage. The shape makes for easier holding. I only wish this devise was maybe 2 inches taller then it would look like a real book

Replacing older reader without a light and traveling overseas soon. With electronics in the cabin under scrutiny, this very small and very lightweight reader fits the bill! Perfect in small purses and large pockets. I can read without annoying seatmate with cabin overhead seat light. Easy to hold in either hand and screen adjusts for whichever direction you're holding it.

I purchased the Kindle Oasis because I was growing increasingly tired of the glare and cumbersome size of reading off my iPad. So the portability is great. And of course, I went for the most expensive, because I wanted the extra battery life. And while the length of time it stays charged is nice, charges very quickly, it's still overpriced. I love the non-glare screen, you can literally read this anywhere. But the wifi connectivity is patchy at best. I have to go upstairs in my home and stand close to the router for the Oasis to connect, this is very annoying. Wouldn't be a big deal if I only read from this one device. But I read from another and picking up where I left off is a pain most times. Non of my issues are really a big deal, but for $300 I don't feel like I should have any issues.

This is not an upgrade by any means! My three year old kindle outperformed Oasis.Battery life better than a week with the lights on lowest setting Magnetic connector is poorly designed and grows weak Two pieces to keep up with; unsnaps constantly Amazon Customer Services promises it will resolved in an update

This is my first e-reader. I didn't know about the odd refresh and it took a little while to get used to but I do love how small and light it is and that I do not have to remember to plug it in everyday

### **Product Recommendation Guide: Kindle Oasis vs Other E-readers**
### ## **Overview**
The Kindle Oasis boasts a high-resolution display and a sleek design that many users appreciate. With over 60 customer reviews averaging a solid 4-star rating, its popularity suggests strong user satisfaction.
### ## ***Customer Sentiment Summary***  
- **Positive**: About 89% of reviewers found value or improvements in features compared to other devices.
- **Negative**: A small portion expressed dissatisfaction mainly due to performance issues relative to older models.
### ### *What Customers Love*
Customers praise the device's weightlessness and portability which allows them to carry their library anywhere without compromising comfort e.g., *Very lightweight*. It also receives commendation for superior battery longevity even when illuminated at low settings (...battery life better...). The ergonomic fit has been highlighted as improving readability significantly (the shape makes easier hold).
### ### ***Common Concerns***
Some customers note that while they prefer the Oasis' physical form factor over alternatives like tablets, there are notable complaints about perceived inferior performance when compared against earlier Kindles. Issues include decreased battery efficiency under certain usage conditions (Battery life worse), suggesting potential compatibility inconsistencies across hardware revisions.
### # **Bottom Line**
**Recommendation:** Ideal for avid readers seeking unparalleled mobility, modern aesthetics, and long-lasting battery power from an e-reader specifically tailored for dedicated literature consumption. Those prioritizing advanced multimedia capabilities might find the investment less compelling given current tablet advancements. Potential buyers may benefit considering personal use patterns—especially regarding screen brightness preferences—and comparing costs versus benefits offered beyond traditional text-based engagement. 
The choice ultimately hinges on whether one values specialized e-literature tools offering unmatched convenience in handheld book-like structures, potentially overlooking aspects where newer technologies shine such as video streaming quality or app integration versatility. For frequent travelers looking to escape into stories rather than digital entertainment diversions, the Oasis presents itself uniquely well-suited among similar gadgets.
